div.p: Jurupa Valley is California's newest city; it is located in the upper western region of Riverside County (Jurupa Valley). It is a city that has a Hispanic population of 68.9%; also, 55.6% of the population speak another language other than English at home (US Census). Despite the the high number of Latinos, the city is still governed by an all white city council, which is similar to what we read in Fulton's text. Most of the Hispanic population is Mexican and is spread out fairly even throughout the city with exception of a higher concentration in Rubidoux and a absence in the Indian Hills area (Policy Map). Furthermore, only 10% of the population have a bachelor's degree and the median per capita income is $19,744 (US Census). When researching the city of Jurupa Valley, themes relating to racial apartheid, the rise of agriburbs, colonies, and the industrial suburb all arise.

note.placeName: Jose Cardona, Jurupa Valley Dog Park
note.p: Jurupa Valley is a city with a large Latino population that shares characteristics with historically discriminated communities.
